posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, mate!

This is a really original build. Looks pretty solid, except for the fact that 41 AB on a non-self buffer is kind of low. However, it has a lot of potential to be a great build in a higher magic setting.

I have been trying to figure out a way to get 14 INT on that build. It's a shame you have very few skill points with such a great skillset to choose from, but the only way I see this happening is by lowering your CON or your CHA. I wouldn't lower CHA, as it's part of the concept here, but on the CON I am truly undecided. I guess it depends on how much access or viability you have to increase your CON magically. 14 INT would give you loads of skill points PLUS access to Expertise / Improved Expertise, which could turn unfavorable battles (you with your lowish AB against a higher AC enemy) into battles of 20's, which in theory favor you because you have Epic Dodge. At the same time, less HP means you'll be more vulnerable to casters. However there is also the dilemma of which feats to drop for Expertise / Improved Expertise. Toughness? LOL You'll be a very fragile meleer.

Now I do have a tweak to suggest. You technically have one "extra" feat there, which is Called Shot. IMO Fighter 17 is absolutely unnecessary as is Called Shot, so you could take Improved Critical with that feat instead (delaying it a lot or rearranging feats and delaying Blind Fight), anticipate Toughness to level 12 and take 5 levels of BG instead of 4, taking the last BG level on a General Feat level so as to take Extra Turning, giving you more DM/DS usage for nothing and putting off one of the Rogue levels into epics.

Other than that, I like the concept. Kudos!

Take it EZ!

posts.author: Bru
posts.content:
Thanks for the reply!

Unfortunately Extra Turning is exclusive to clerics and paladins (sigh ). Amulet of Divine Radiance (+6 CHA, Extra Turning as bonus feat) is a must for this build.

The 17th level fighter is necessary to avoid xp penalty, but if one is willing to trade hit points for skill points and have xp penalty in the transition between levels 39-40, you can replace it with the 5th-level blackguard and bring taunt 41 ... you possibly can replace ESF (Discipline) with ESF (Taunt) since there are many more magic items that grant bonuses in Discipline rather than Taunt.



sorry for bad English

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
I didn't know that about Extra Turning.

Good thinking on Taunt, it would be even better if you had Expertise. Divine Shield gives Dodge bonuses, so when you are Taunting you lose them. Expertise is a great way to maintain a somewhat competitive AC while Taunting and these skills combo well together if used correctly. It requires a bit of practice, but shouldn't be hard for anyone. If you want to know specifically how to use that combo, read my Paladin guide here in the guild.

P.S.: Your English is great. I am an English teacher in RL and you wrote perfectly.

Take it EZ!
